unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Graduation Gowns
question_text:
College graduates purchase their gowns based on their height. One graduation gown manufacturer measures a sample of graduates to see if it needs to increase its inventory in the taller sizes. The average height in the random sample of customers was $67\text{ inches}$ with a standard deviation of $4\text{ inches}$.
Which distribution should the manufacturer use to calculate a $95\%$ confidence interval for the average height of its customers? Why?

choices.text: The $z$-distribution should be used because the confidence interval is being constructed for a mean.
The $z$-distribution should be used because the confidence interval is being constructed for a proportion.
The $t$-distribution should be used because the confidence interval is being constructed for a mean.
The $t$-distribution should be used because the confidence interval is being constructed for a proportion.
The chi-square distribution should be used because the confidence interval is being constructed for a proportion.

solution:
This problem describes a confidence interval for the average height (mean) and the population standard deviation is unknown, so the $t$-distribution should be used.

Explanation of Distractors

Choices 'A', 'B', and 'D' are incorrect. $Z$-distributions are used in confidence intervals for proportions and for means when the population standard deviation is known.

Choice 'E' is incorrect. Chi-square distributions are used in hypothesis tests comparing counts of categorical variables.
